title: How to Bake Apricot and Semolina Cake

steps.headline: Prepare the cake tin in advance.
steps.description: Grease or line the round cake tin. Preheat the oven to moderate (180ºC/350ºF).

steps.headline: Pour boiling water over the apricots in a sturdy bowl.
steps.description: Allow to soak for 10 minutes, or until softened.

steps.headline: Cream together butter and sugar in a small bowl with an electric mixture; or, beat by hand if preferred.
steps.description: The mixture should turn pale in colour.

steps.headline: Add the eggs one after the other, beating in each one well.
Add sifted flour, semolina and apricot nectar.
Pour three quarters of the mixture into the pan.
Spread the softened apricots across the mixture.
Pour the remaining mixture over the top of the apricots.
Bake.
steps.description: Put the cake in the oven and bake for 50 minutes or until the cake is ready when a skewer poked in it comes out clean.

steps.headline: Place the cake on a wire cake rack to cool.
Make the syrup as the cake cools.
steps.description: In a heavy-based saucepan, combine the sugar and water. Stir over low heat until the sugar dissolves. Bring to the boil and then simmer for approximately 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and add the rosewater. Stir in and the syrup is ready for use.

steps.headline: Pour the syrup over the slightly cooled cake.
steps.description: The right side for the cake should the apricots nearer the top of the cake.

steps.headline: Finish with a dusting of sifted icing sugar.

text: Prepare the cake tin in advance. Grease or line the round cake tin. Preheat the oven to moderate (180ºC/350ºF). Pour boiling water over the apricots in a sturdy bowl. Allow to soak for 10 minutes, or until softened. Cream together butter and sugar in a small bowl with an electric mixture; or, beat by hand if preferred. The mixture should turn pale in colour. Add the eggs one after the other, beating in each one well.  Add sifted flour, semolina and apricot nectar. Stir well. Pour three quarters of the mixture into the pan.  Spread the softened apricots across the mixture.  Pour the remaining mixture over the top of the apricots.  Bake. Put the cake in the oven and bake for 50 minutes or until the cake is ready when a skewer poked in it comes out clean. Place the cake on a wire cake rack to cool.  Make the syrup as the cake cools. In a heavy-based saucepan, combine the sugar and water. Stir over low heat until the sugar dissolves. Bring to the boil and then simmer for approximately 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and add the rosewater. Stir in and the syrup is ready for use. Pour the syrup over the slightly cooled cake. The right side for the cake should the apricots nearer the top of the cake. Finish with a dusting of sifted icing sugar.  Finished.
